all_numeric_objectives.description: If true, appends all numeric fields to objective_fields.

lambda.description: Used when generating predictions with missing data

objective_class.description: The class that this tree targets, used when boosting for classification

objective_field.description: The field id of the original objective field when boosting is enabled

weight.description: The tree's weight when boosting (learning rate + step size)

boosting_id.description: For boosting trees, the identifier of their boosting model

address.description: For MSG callbacks, the mailbox address to use

delay.description: Seed for an initial random delay before first call, in millisecs.  The actual delay is this value plus a random number in [0, 1000)

fire_once.description: A flag specifying whether callbacks should be called at most once, even if the job is requeued and retraces previous states

order.description: Trigger ordering.  Smaller (or nil) orders are triggered first, with progress callbacks taking preference over state callbacks.  Synchronous and asynchronous callbacks are ordered independently.  Callbacks with the same order, states and synchronicity are triggered in the order they are received.

payload.description: The payload to be used as a message body

progress_variation.description: A number in (0, 1) which gives the variation in progress that will trigger this callback.

register-address.description: For MSG callbacks, whether to register the requested address if it does not yet exist (i.e., whether to create the associated message queue when the mailbox is RabbitMQ)

retries.description: Number of times the callback is retried on failures

retry_delay.description: Seed for a exponential back-off between retries, in millisecs

states.description: A list of states for which the callback should be called. If not given, the callback will be called for either the given progress variation or, if that's not provided, for all state changes

synchronous.description: A flag specifying wether the callback is synchronous and we need to wait for a remote response before proceeding

timeout.description: Lapse in millisecs waiting for the callback to get a response

url.description: The URL to invoke with the method above

dataset_id.description: Identifier of this model's main dataset

dataset_ids.description: Identifiers of this model's additional datasets

default_numeric_value.description: Catch-all missing filler for numeric fields.

default_values.description: A map for field identifiers to values for missing entries.

depth_threshold.description: The depth limit for a tree

pretty.description: Whether edge boundaries are rounded values

trim.description: Proportion of data to trim from outer edges of distribution

type.description: Discretize into bins of equal width or population

discretization.description: Parameters to control the discetization of numeric fields

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values. During model construction, the counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

categories.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple contains a category and the category occurrence count.  Used when the objective is categorical. For partial models, counts are an estimation and, as such, they won't be in general integers.  But finished models the pairs will always consist of a string and an integer.

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts.  Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values. During model construction, these counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

exact.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures whether the histogram is approximate or represents the distribution exactly

maximum.description: Maximum value for numeric fields, used when 'bins' are present

populations.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the population of each eqi-width bin

start.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width this captures the lower edge of the first bin

width.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the width of each eqi-width bin

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values. During model construction, the counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

categories.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple contains a category and the category occurrence count.  Used when the objective is categorical. For partial models, counts are an estimation and, as such, they won't be in general integers.  But finished models the pairs will always consist of a string and an integer.

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts.  Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values. During model construction, these counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

exact.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures whether the histogram is approximate or represents the distribution exactly

maximum.description: Maximum value for numeric fields, used when 'bins' are present

populations.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the population of each eqi-width bin

start.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width this captures the lower edge of the first bin

width.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the width of each eqi-width bin

distribution.description: The training data distribution across predicted values, initially and after flowing through the tree

excluded_input_fields.description: List of field identifiers, names or columns to exclude from input

excluded_input_fields_regexps.description: List of regular expressions, excluding input fields  by name

auto_generated.description: True if the field was generated from another field

child_ids.description: IDs of the children if this generates other fields

datatype.description: The storage type of the field

description.description: Free text description of the field

label.description: A label for the field (free text for use by clients)

parent_ids.description: IDs of the parents if this is a generated field

preferred.description: Whether the field is used by default for model creation

provenance.description: Field value origin (when the value is generated)

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts. Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values

kurtosis.description: The sample kurtosis for numeric fields

mean.description: The sample mean for numeric fields

median.description: The approximate median for numeric fields

population.description: # of instances containing data for this field

skewness.description: The sample skewness for numeric fields

standard_deviation.description: The sample standard deviation for numeric fields

sum_squares.description: Sum of squared values (for variance calculation)

variance.description: The sample variance for numeric fields

auto_generated.description: True if the field was generated from another field

child_ids.description: IDs of the children if this generates other fields

datatype.description: The storage type of the field

description.description: Free text description of the field

label.description: A label for the field (free text for use by clients)

parent_ids.description: IDs of the parents if this is a generated field

preferred.description: Whether the field is used by default for model creation

provenance.description: Field value origin (when the value is generated)

average_length.description: The average # of chars for non-missing values

tag_cloud.description: Top terms with number of occurences

term_forms.description: Dictionary of multi-form terms to all forms seen

case_sensitive.description: Defines whether the term analysis is case sensitive

enabled.description: Enable/disables term analysis for this field.  Has no effect except for dataset creation.

excluded_terms.description: A list of terms to ignore when performing term analysis

language.description: Language code for detected language, or 'none' for no detection, or nil to let us detect it.

ngrams.description: The maximum length of consecutive tokens to consider as terms

stem_words.description: Defines whether the term analysis stems words

stopword_diligence.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses stop words

stopword_removal.description: Remove words that are stopwords in any language.

term_filters.description: A list of filters to apply when choosing the termset

term_regexps.description: A list of regular expressions to consider as terms

token_mode.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses full terms, tokenized terms, or both

use_stopwords.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses stop words

maximum.description: Maximum datetime, as a string value

maximum_timestamp.description: Maximum datetime, as a numeric epoch

minimum.description: Minimum datetime, as a string value

minimum_timestamp.description: Minimum datetime, as a numeric epoch

non_decreasing.description: True if times never decrease with row number

non_increasing.description: True if times never increase with row number

time_formats.description: Formats of times in this field from clj-time

separator.description: Character delimiting items in the field. Set to null to autodetect if there is no regular expression.

separator_regexp.description: Regular expression delimiting items in the field. Overrides item_separator.

target_frequency.description: A ratio in (0, 1] with the occurence rate used when the prunning_strategy is nearest_to_frequency

item_analysis.description: Parameters controlling how items are extracted from text

enabled.description: Enable/disables term analysis for this field.  Has no effect except for dataset creation.

excluded_terms.description: A list of terms to ignore when performing term analysis

language.description: Language code for detected language, or 'none' for no detection, or nil to let us detect it.

ngrams.description: The maximum length of consecutive tokens to consider as terms

stem_words.description: Defines whether the term analysis stems words

stopword_diligence.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses stop words

stopword_removal.description: Remove words that are stopwords in any language.

term_filters.description: A list of filters to apply when choosing the termset

term_regexps.description: A list of regular expressions to consider as terms

token_mode.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses full terms, tokenized terms, or both

use_stopwords.description: Defines whether the term analysis uses stop words

objective_field_descriptor.description: The full descriptor of the objective field, when there's only one.

objective_weights.description: For classification models, this maps the objective classes to class weights

positive_class.description: The class the threshold applies to

operating_point.description: Default operating point to be used by this model during predictions

apian_dataset_id.description: The apian id of the dataset over which to run the search

apian_query_params.description: Additional query params to add to all URL requests in the optimization execution

apian_test_dataset_id.description: The apian id of the dataset for validation

apian_uri.description: The base URI to which API requests should go in the optimization execution

dataset_id.description: The id of the dataset over which to run the search

excluded_input_fields.description: ids of fields to be excluded for all models

input_fields.description: ids of fields to be included for all models

max_training_time.description: Wall-clock time (in seconds) that the search was run.

model_types.description: List of model types to try or empty for all

number_of_model_candidates.description: The number of models tried in the model search

objective_field.description: The id for the objective field of all models

seed.description: The random seed for the search

test_dataset_id.description: The id of a dataset to use for testing, or nil for random splits

tlp.description: Maximum number of simultaneous, non-finished, resource creation tasks.

optimization_params.description: Parameters to use for optimizing when optimized is true

optimize.description: Whether we should infer the best parameterization using  an optimization

prune_holdout.description: DEPRECATED - Pruning with a holdout set

random_candidate_ratio.description: Similar to 'random_candidates' but expressed as a ratio of the total candidates (between 0 and 1)

random_candidates.description: Sets the number of random fields considered when 'randomize' is true. By default this is the square root of the total number of input fields. Also known as 'mtry' in the R random forest package

randomize.description: When true only a random subset of fields are considered for each split (ala random forests)

confidence.description: Probability of correctness for classification and an estimate of the error for regression

count.description: Number of training instances at this node

distribution.description: DEPRECATED - Distribution of the target at this node

id.description: The node id, assigned depth first starting with 0

bins.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple represents a bin from an approximate histogram.  Each bin contains the bin mean and a membership count.  Used when there are more than 32 unique numeric values. During model construction, the counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

categories.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Each tuple contains a category and the category occurrence count.  Used when the objective is categorical. For partial models, counts are an estimation and, as such, they won't be in general integers.  But finished models the pairs will always consist of a string and an integer.

counts.description: Captures the distribution for the objective field.  Contains tuples of the unique values and their occurrence counts.  Used when there are 32 or less unique numeric values. During model construction, these counts can be fractional for partial models.  When the model is finished, however, all counts will be integers.

exact.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures whether the histogram is approximate or represents the distribution exactly

maximum.description: Maximum value for numeric fields, used when 'bins' are present

populations.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the population of each eqi-width bin

start.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width this captures the lower edge of the first bin

width.description: When the numeric distribution is in eqi-width format this captures the width of each eqi-width bin

objective_summary.description: Distribution for the the prediction at this point

field.description: Identifier of the field used for this decision

importance.description: Optional importance of this decision to the 'enclosing' combination of model and input.

operator.description: Operator used to test the field's value

term.description: The term/word of interest for the predicate. The occurance count of this term will be the value that is split on.

value.description: Value used, besides the field's, for this decision

weight.description: Total weight at this node (if tree is weighted)

root.description: The root node of the decision tree

row_range.description: Rows used to build this object

row_ranges.description: Rows used to build this object, per dataset

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

sample.description: Sampling of input rows used to build this object

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

out_of_bag.description: Is the sampling out of bag?

rate.description: The rate: fraction of rows we pick

replace.description: Whether we sample with replacement or not

seed.description: A string to feed the random number generator used for sampling.  The same seed produces always the same sample (if all other parameters stay the same).  If not specified, we choose a seed at random

samples.description: Sampling of rows used to build this object, per dataset

selective_pruning.description: When true, stat pruning will have less effect for small datasets

split_candidates.description: The maximum number of split points considered for each numeric split

split_criterion.description: Method of choosing best attribute and split point for a given node

stat_pruning.description: Eliminates low confidence leaf nodes from tree statistical tests

support_threshold.description: Controls the minimum support each child node must contain for a split to be valid. Since instances may have non-integer weights, non-integer values are valid.

area_under_pr_curve.description: Area under the precision/recall curve for this class

area_under_roc_curve.description: Area under the ROC curve for this class

max_phi.description: The max value for phi at any threshold for this class

present_in_test_data.description: Whether or not this class was seen in the test data for the evaluation

type.description: Identifier of this model's type (e.g., regression)
